availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Nancy Phipps Cates on January 2, 1817. Father of James Cates, Jane Cates, Alex Cates, Benjamin Cates, Charles H. Cates, Richard Cates, Sarah Cates, and Elias Cates. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 141. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 147. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 4, Subdivision 192, p. 1. Jordan Dodd, Kentucky Marriages, 1802-1850, Ancestry, Hopkins County, Kentucky, 1817. KYR-0001-029-0571.
